==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=师|alt=𠦵,𠵀,𢂖,𢃋,𨸲,𨸴,𩇱}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|𠂤|帀|ls=ic|t1=mound, hill}} – ancient troops were usually stationed at a hill.

Each of the two components can be used as {{lang|zh|師}} on their own in preclassical scripts. The significance of {{lang|zh|帀}} is debated.

===Etymology===
{{zh-ref|Starostin}} derives this word from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*rij||many}}, cognate with {{och-l|皆|all|tr=*kriːj}}, {{och-l|偕|together with|tr=*kriːj}}, as well as {{cog|bo|ཁྲི||ten thousand}} and {{cog|my|ရဲ||police}}.
